job_title: Diagnostic Medical Sonographer in Pensacola, FL
pros: Great coworkers and supervisors. Good work-life balance.
cons: Low wages, poor health benefits, annual merit increase of 0.56 cents, day shift workers forced to leave work early if off hour shifts have low volume.

pros: Not much anymore. Things have changed

review_title: Don't work for them long term
job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Tampa, FL
pros: Easy to get hired and get experience. Scheduling was simple and easy to pick up hours. I could text a manager if I wanted to pick up and they would answer relatively fast and I would usually get the shift. You can make some really good friends/coworkers. Experienced nurses waiting for retirement stick around so you have them for knowledge and guidance. You most likely won't get fired because they need you more than you need them.
cons: Management. Staff is not appreciated enough for the amount of work put in. People suck up to the management which further inflates egos. A lot of passive-aggressive people in management/leadership roles. Unit director was very "fake" which then leads to a not-so-great work environment. Clocking in and clocking out situation was weird... it rounds up or down instead of just paying people the actual minutes that they're there for. Still using Meditech EHR. Not supportive when you're simply leaving for growth and better opportunities... management got very short and took it personally. Not professional at all.

pros: There are very few pros in a for profit hospital
cons: Staffing is really bad at HCA. They prioritize profits over patients

job_title: Float Pool RN in Pensacola, FL
pros: decent pay for the pensacola area i had really good managers
cons: high staff turnover constantly unsafe patient ratios/practices

job_title: PCT Patient Care Tech in Pensacola, FL
pros: 3 twelve-hour shifts with 4 days off.
cons: Must work on certain holidays.

pros: Great place to work and grow
cons: Budgeting, metrics, metrics, metrics, budgeting

review_title: Change in Management is Driving people away and changing the culture
pros: Incredible people, the teamwork is unmatched.
cons: New management displays through their conduct that they do not care about their team. Ruining the culture and chemistry of the ER. They clearly value their authority over their relationships.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Pensacola, FL
pros: The benefits were nice, and I loved the patients that came through.
cons: There is absolutely no support for new RNs. They have the StarRN program, but they make you sign a contract to stay 2 years and tell you if you break it, you owe them 10k. Managers always hide out in their offices and never check-in with the new nurses to see how they are doing. They will call out for everyone else to come in and help when short staffed but refuse to get out and be on the floor themselves. The other nurses have cliques. It is also very common for people of “higher rank” to refuse to help with any parts of patient care. I would not recommend this hospital to any new nurses.

pros: great coworkers and school assistance
cons: corporate feel and tends to stay behind area's average pay

pros: Surgeons are great for the most part.
cons: Worst management I’ve ever experienced. Zero accountability or loyalty

review_title: Do Not Judge A Book By It’s Cover!

cons: HR are RUDE! Computer software is beyond outdated (used same software over 20 years ago). Staff is very pleasant to patients and visitors but not as friendly to co-workers.

review_title: Best Pay in area....thats about it

cons: Unsafe Patient to Nurse ratios, Short Staffed all the time, Usually end up providing total patient care because there are never enough Techs, Do not go here as a new nurse, you will be put in a contract, you'll have to uphold your end, but they will not uphold theirs, and the way the contract is worded, there is nothing you can do about it.

pros: Some coworkers are great workers.  Usually have supplies so we can do our jobs
